intro: Trichomanes lanceum, commonly known as the lance fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Hymenophyllaceae. It is a small, delicate plant characterized by its lance-shaped fronds and intricate, finely divided leaves. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, it thrives in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests. The plant has a unique reproductive structure, with spore-producing sporangia located on the underside of its leaves. Its botanical features make it an important component of epiphytic ecosystems in its native habitat.
